definitions.definition: A crack , crevice , fissure , or hole which admits water or other fluid , or lets it escape .
The entrance or escape of a fluid through a crack , fissure , or other aperture .
examples: The leak gained on the ship's pumps.
The babies' diapers had big leaks .

definitions.definition: A divulgation , or disclosure , of information previously held secret.
examples: The leaks by Chelsea Manning showed the secrets of the US military.

definitions.definition: The person through whom such divulgation, or disclosure, occurs.
A loss of electricity through imperfect insulation , or the point where it occurs.
The gradual loss of a system resource caused by failure to deallocate previously reserved portions.

examples: I have to take a leak .
definitions.label_groups: mildly vulgar , slang , especially with the verb "take"

main_definition: A crack , crevice , fissure , or hole which admits water or other fluid , or lets it escape .
secondary_definitions: The entrance or escape of a fluid through a crack , fissure , or other aperture .
A divulgation , or disclosure , of information previously held secret.
The person through whom such divulgation, or disclosure, occurs.
A loss of electricity through imperfect insulation , or the point where it occurs.
( computing ) The gradual loss of a system resource caused by failure to deallocate previously reserved portions.
( mildly vulgar , slang , especially with the verb "take" ) An act of urination .
